BodyName: Committee on Women and Gender Equity
Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Health

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Health
Oversight - Sexual and Reproductive Rights in New York City
Items.ActionText: This Oversight was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Oversight - Sexual and Reproductive Rights in New York City

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of an advisory board for gender and racial equity in hospitals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Creation of an advisory board for gender and racial equity in hospitals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training and inspections regarding lactation rooms
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Training and inspections regarding lactation rooms.

Items.Title: Resolution urging the United States Congress and the New York State Legislature to support a woman’s right to abortion, and to oppose a ban on sex-selective abortions, which perpetuate racial stereotypes and undermine access to care.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Support a woman’s right to abortion, and to oppose a ban on sex-selective abortions, which perpetuate racial stereotypes and undermine access to care.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to make available FDA-approved methods of non-surgical contraception and long-acting reversible contraception at its health centers, health stations, health clinics and other health facilities
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to make available FDA-approved methods of non-surgical contraception and long-acting reversible contraception at its health centers, health stations, health clinics and other health facilities.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to conduct a public information and outreach campaign regarding medically unnecessary treatments or interventions on individuals born with intersex traits or variations in sex characteristics
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to conduct a public information and outreach campaign regarding medically unnecessary treatments or interventions on individuals born with intersex traits or variations in sex characteristics.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Federal Government to dismiss the change to Title X funding, specifically to prohibit recipients from using Title X funds to perform, promote, refer for, or support abortion as a method of family planning.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Calling on the Federal Government to dismiss the change to Title X funding, specifically to prohibit recipients from using Title X funds to perform, promote, refer for, or support abortion as a method of family planning.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing an advisory committee on female genital mutilation and cutting and making technical amendments in connection therewith
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing an advisory committee on female genital mutilation and cutting and making technical amendments in connection therewith.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to culturally competent training on recognizing the signs of female genital mutilation
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Culturally competent training on recognizing the signs of female genital mutilation.

Items.Title: Roll Call

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending:  Barron, Rivera, Adams, Ampry-Samuel, Dromm, Holden, Kallos, Lander, Louis, Cumbo, Powers, Eugene and Gibson.
